thread.title: David Ramsey Explains Why Arrow Would Still Beat Flash In A Fight
thread.title_full: David Ramsey Explains Why Arrow Would Still Beat Flash In A Fight

author: Matthew Mueller
title: David Ramsey Explains Why Arrow Would Still Beat Flash In A Fight
text:
David Ramsey Explains Why Arrow Would Still Beat Flash In A Fight Matthew Mueller Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of 
Arrow and the Flash have teamed up now on several occasions, but they also clashed a bit when they first met. Now that some time has passed and Flash has a bit more experience, some have wondered if the result would be different this time around. 
Fans had a chance to ask Arrow stars Stephen Amell and David Ramsey a few questions during a Wizard World Q&A, including if Flash would win a fight with Arrow now that he's had some time to get more used to his powers. Ramsey jumped at the chance to answer. 
"That is a great question. I'm going to handle that one boo boo. I think Arrow would still win. I just think experience trumps power, right. I think Oliver Queen would find a way like Bruce Wayne to beat all the superpowered guys. Oliver Queen kind of deals with this kind of criminal aspect, this dark side of himself a lot like Bruce Wayne, and I just think that is what gives him the edge, and Barry Allen just doesn't have that." 
Batman has always plotted a few steps ahead of everyone, even his teammates much to their chagrin, and Oliver does have those same tendencies. Still, there are those who might think speed trumps experience, so both sides have a winnable argument. 
You can watch the full panel above. 
The official description for the Arrow midseason premiere can be found below. 
OLIVER WANTS JUSTICE; FELICITY WANTS REVENGE — Worried that Prometheus is right and he is truly a killer at heart, Oliver (Stephen Amell) looks for any ray of hope and finds it in what seems to be the miraculous return of Laurel Lance (guest star Katie Cassidy). 
However, Felicity (Emily Bett Rickards), still reeling from Detective Malone’s murder, is bent on revenge – she wants to stop Prometheus at any cost. While in prison, Diggle (David Ramsey) fights for his life. 
Gregory Smith directed the episode written by Ben Sokolowski & Brian Ford Sullivan. 
Arrow airs Wednesday nights at 8 p.m. ET/PT on The CW . "Who Are You?" debuts on January 25, 2017. Arrow Wednesday at 8 PM ET on CW ComicBook Composite 83.91 #12 All-Time Comic TV Shows Average rating
